intro: Tetrameris martiana, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Tetrameris martiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
